wikipedia_page.main: Jim Baker is a former Northern Irish international lawn and indoor bowler.

response: * Jim Baker (politician) (fl. 2000s–2010s), Canadian legislator from Labrador West in Newfoundland/Labrador House of Assembly
* Jim Baker (footballer) (1891–1966), English professional centre back during the 1910s and 1920s for Leeds United A.F.C.
* Jim Baker (bowls) (born 1958), Northern Irish and combined Irish lawn and indoor bowls player
* Jim Baker (frontiersman) (1818–1898), American trapper, scout and guide
* A. J. Baker or Jim Baker (1922–2017), Australian philosopher
He was part of the winning Irish Fours team in the 2004 World Bowls Championships held in Ayr, Scotland with Jim Baker, Neil Booth and Noel Graham.

John Watson won the title beating Jim Baker in the final. The third place play off was won by John Dunn who defeated John Fullarton 21–19.
Jim Baker won the title beating Nigel Smith in the final 21–18.

Booth has won three World Championship medals starting with the gold medal in the fours at the 2004 World Outdoor Bowls Championship in Ayr with Jonathan Ross, Noel Graham and Jim Baker. This was followed by two bronze medals in 2012.
|  Jim Baker Noel Graham
Espie won the gold medal in the triples event with teammates Sammy Allen and Jim Baker at the 1984 World Outdoor Bowls Championship in Aberdeen.

link_mentions.page: 2004 World Outdoor Bowls Championship – Men's fours
response: Jonathan Ross, Noel Graham, Neil Booth and Jim Baker of Ireland won the gold medal.
|1 || align="left"|25px Jonathan Ross, Noel Graham, Neil Booth, Jim Baker       || 5 || 4 ||0|| 1 || 105|| 65 || 8
In the World Championships he won gold medal in the fours with Jonathan Ross, Neil Booth and Jim Baker and a silver medal with Jim Baker in the pairs during the 2004 World Outdoor Bowls Championship.

He was born in 1966 and won the bronze medal in the fours with Noel Graham, Neil Booth and Jim Baker at the 2002 Commonwealth Games in Manchester.  He bowls for the Old Bleach Bowling Club  and was the National triples champion in 2001 and 2019.
|  Jim Baker
The 'Jimmy Donnelly Trophy', an award given to Ireland's best bowler at the annual British Isles International series is named after him. He was a mentor to Jim Baker.
